question: A can do a piece of work in 4 hours, B and C can do it in 3 hours. A and C can do it in 2 hours. How long will B alone take to do it?
explanation:
A\'s one hour\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{4}&s=1$
(B + C)\'s one hour\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{3}&s=1$
(A + C)\'s one hour\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{2}&s=1$
âˆ´ C\'s one hour\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{2}-\\frac{1}{4} = \\frac{2-1}{4} = \\frac{1}{4}&s=1$
B\'s one hour\'s work $latex = \\frac{1}{3}-\\frac{1}{4} = \\frac{4-3}{12} = \\frac{1}{12}&s=1$
Hence B alone can do the work in 12 hours, so option [D] is correct answer
